name: Sofitel Biarritz Le Miramar Thalassa sea & spa

reviews.title: business trip Bayonne
reviews.text: Excellent hotel, fantastic location close to Biarritz center, directly on the beach, friendly staff. Hotel has an excellent swimming pool, very convenient fitness possibilities, so all in all a real recommendation. One remark: prices of food and thalassa services are in my view too high.

This is the perfect spot for a wonderful getaway - apart from that the price is high, admittedly. We stayed 7 nights at this wonderful hotel, had 7 days breakfast and were delighted all along. Guests are all ages, there were several families with children at all ages which was nice. Breakfast is excellent (price is high again, but..). We did not eat at the restaurant. The outdoor pool is marvellous, and due to the temparature one can swim even when it is raining. The sea to which you have direct access from the hotel is wild and extatic. Views to the sea are just breathtaking. For those interested (I did not see any comment on this before), the Hammam is excellent and has two rooms, one is nicely hot. The fitness room equipment is ok. We did not use the SPA (apart from a short treatment which was awarded to us). What stood out to us, apart from the beautiful settings, is the excellent service we received at all times. They are quick at cleaning the rooms, breakfast service is friendly, fast and smooth, the valet parking is excellent, we had a little problem with the DVD which was resolved in a fraction of a second, whatever we asked for was dealt with so speedy and smoothly. They really have a sense for service.
reviews.title: Wonderful spot, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service and view (if you can get a room facing the sea). The hotel staff from the receptionist to the concierge were extremely helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great service, decor is a little tired
Great setting
reviews.text: Our room and the corridors leading to it were quite tired due to heavy use ... must be nearly time for a refurbishment I imagine. The room was well appointed with all the mod-cons although the toilet was tiny and bath not even close to full length. This was in a delux sea-view room!

reviews.text: The concierge is quite nice but with poor time of work (impossible to book a restaurant after 9.00 pm !)
reviews.title: The perfect getaway
Good location
reviews.text: Comfortable hotel with great beds. We did experience building works but our room was changed and a special thanks to Celine the Director who organised this for us. The reception Manager Catherine was too busy to help us apparently which was surprising for a five star hotel. However the location of the hotel is very good and whilst parking is overpriced it does keep your car safe. There are some very good restaurants close to the hotel and the other ladies on reception and the concierge are both knowledgeable and very helpful.

This modern hotel tucked into a small side street in Biarritz has large, comfortable rooms overlooking the sea. Although the feel of the hotel isn't posh, it's a great choice when visiting the Basque Country. Gorgeous pool and spa are worth a visit.
reviews.title: Lovely view in Biarritz!

reviews.text: professional and were happy to recommend restaurants and planned a self drive sightseeing tour when we asked. The hotel had a large lobby, the rooms were not big but very luxurious and comfortable (bed was amazing) with a lovely bathroom. We paid extra for a sea view terrace that was big enough to relax on and worth the extra. Even in October the weather was good enough to use the outside pool and the pool staff ensured everything was set up as we wanted and drinks/lunch could be brought to you from the restaurant bar.
reviews.title: Central location with sea view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great place in every sense. In my opinion you get the best thalasso therapy here and the hotel is perfect. If you do not mind the extra expense, book a room with sea view to watch the waves. March is still low season for price but probably the best month if you are going for the treatment. Short walk to the town which is a little jewel and offers all you are looking for, incl. a free shuttle bus taking you all over town. Great shopping, lots of good restaurants.
reviews.title: Great place in beautiful surroundings

reviews.text: From outside, hotel building is not the best in town, but inside is very nice and confortable. Good service,very good thalasso center,good restaurants,very nice room and beautiful sea water pool. 5 min walking from town center. Direct acces to grand plage.
reviews.title: thalasso

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION
reviews.title: The best ocean front location in Biarritz, great outdoor pool, average rooms and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After examining the area we would say that the hotel has the best location in terms of the beach and especially ocean and bay views (though looks ugly against the background of other Biarritz buildings). The views from the neighboring Palace can somehow compete with the views from Sofitel, but only a few rooms in the Palace have a small balcony (with almost no possibility to comfortably seat there) and big windows directly facing the ocean. The obvious advantage of Sofitel is that it has enormous glass windows and big balconies with many of them facing the ocean.
reviews.title: Beautiful Biarritz

reviews.text: HOTEL
reviews.title: great food ,great views of the atlantic clean large rooms .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition to all the good things that I have written about this fabulous hotel previously, I now wish to add that the improved breakfast buffet is just about the best and most complete in the world. And the breakfast staff are just as friendly and efficient as in the other parts of the hotel.
reviews.title: Ah, the breakfast!

reviews.text: Great facilities, clean rooms and bathrooms, polite and friendly staff. A short walk from the town centre and right by the beach.
reviews.title: Good, would stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We shared a suite which had 2 TVs, a coffee machine, sound system, twin beds, sofabed, desk, coffee tables, chairs, ensuite bathroom. All were working properly and the room was well cleaned. We tried out the indoor swimming pool and the hammam, both were great. The only comment I would make about those would be to keep them open a little longer as they are closed at lunchtime and after 7.30pm.
reviews.title: Nice stay for new year

reviews.text: Exterior is a bit ugly, especially compared to the surrounding buildings, but that doesn't matter once you're inside.
reviews.title: Comfortable well located hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in October 2012 . Firstly we arrived at 8.30 pm with children so went straight to the restaurant for dinner. As we received no service at all after waiting at our table for 20 mins we left and found a nice place to eat in town. We tried again at breakfast - it took 45 mins to receive our fried eggs! Breakfast was otherwise nice . It was overpriced. Service patchy at best- after living in France for 4 months one expects a friendly bonjour from staff but generally I felt ignored here. Also for a 5 star hotel I thought it claustrophobic in the corridors - I am of average height but could touch the ceilings. Either Sofitel should raise the overall standard of the place or lower the price . I rate it 4 stars only.
reviews.title: I would have hoped for better in a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: Had 3 nights here in a Superior room. Rooms are nicely sized and well equipped. Good coffee machine in the room. Also had a nice terrace with a view. Reasonably well equipped gym and nice pool area overlooking the ocean. Exterior of the hotel is very dated and is in desperate need of an update and a paint job. Staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Well located but could do with an update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived and were left waiting until 4.00 pm for our room and only got it when we complained. Our room had a balcony but no view whatsoever. Cleaning products were left in the room. The bed was uncomfortable and I awoke with backache. We avoided breakfast as at 28 euros we considered it extortionate. We had an excellent breakfast in town for far less. We booked some massages which in the leaflet stated they were for one hour. The lady on the spa reception said they were only for 50 minutes which turned out to be 45 minutes. At 110 euros each also extortionate especially as we were given only 3/4 of the published time.
reviews.title: Beware of the extortionate prices

reviews.text: My wife wanted a gin and tonic from the minibar in the room. We expected it to be expensive but 18 euros for a miniature gin and tiny tonic !!!
reviews.title: Lovely stay at Biarritz ......

description: This luxury hotel and its thalassotherapy institute are located in Biarritz on the Basque Coast, just a stone's throw from the golf course and near to the town center with its luxury boutiques, cosy tearooms, theaters and museums. The hotel's bedrooms boast a balcony and terrace that overlook the magnificent beach. A breathtaking view and truly enchanting setting.
